definition: mythical animal that brings luck and wards off evil, having head of a dragon and lion's body, often with hoofs, wings and tail/also written 辟邪/fig. valiant soldier
see 貔貅[pi2 xiu1], composite mythical animal (originally 貔 was the male)
see 貔貅[pi2 xiu1], composite mythical animal (originally 貅 was the female)
lit. inviting wealth/We wish you success and riches (cf idiom 招財進寶|招财进宝[zhao1 cai2 jin4 bao3])
to ward off evil spirits/mythical lion-like animal that wards off evil (also called 貔貅[pi2 xiu1])
ushering in wealth and prosperity (idiom and traditional greeting, esp. at New Year); We wish you wealth and success!
citrine (orange or yellow quartz SiO2 as a semiprecious stone)
White Tiger (the seven mansions of the west sky)/(slang) hairless female genitalia
stone tablet erected to ward off evil spirits
auspicious sculpted animal, usu. a unicorn or deer with a long tail/possession of the empire
to accept a life of ease/to enjoy a comfortable retirement
